intro: Collomia gracilis var. congesta, commonly known as the clustered flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are hairy and have a distinct glandular texture. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
